intro: Stichorkis kemulensis, commonly known as the Kemulensis Stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
